page.title: 13Winster Village Church
page.content: The parish church is the only church in the village, any non-conformists, RCs, or people of other faiths have to go beyond the boundary of the village. Although the vicar has 3 other adjoining parishes to care for a service is held each day as well as Sunday. It is only a smal church with one bell in the open tower. Inside it has bright, old stone glass in the east window., and an old octagonal medieval font. The organ is dated 1928. In 1977 a modern and unique patchwork hanging was made by sisters of acarmelite monastry, given to Mrs Evan Thomas, who then presented it to the church. The church won the Deanery Award in 1983 for a truly welcoming church.
